Key Match Events: Tyler Herro and Jaime Jaquez Jr. each drained key free throws in the waning moments to seal the win for the Miami Heat.
Bam Adebayo hit two buckets in a row with under three minutes left to break an 86-86 tie.
The Heat scored six straight midway through the fourth to go ahead by four, but the Jazz caught up with 3:31 to go after buckets by Collin Sexton and Walker Kessler.
Post-Match Reflections: The Miami Heat improved to 2-1 on its six-game trip with the win.
The Utah Jazz lost their second straight outing and ended up losing for the ninth consecutive time at the Delta Center.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Neither team shot well, with the Jazz making 39.8 percent of their shots and the Heat shooting 39.6 percent.
The Jazz started strong, taking a 20-10 lead when Lauri Markkanen dropped in a 3-pointer.
Miami surged back and held a 46-41 halftime lead by holding Utah to 14 points in the second quarter.
Others: Tyler Herro scored 23 points for the Miami Heat.
Jaime Jaquez Jr. added 20 points for the Heat.
Lauri Markkanen and Collin Sexton each scored 23 points for the Jazz.
